Package com.atakmap.android.video

Class VideoViewLayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.atakmap.android.video.VideoViewLayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Disposable
    public class VideoViewLayer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Disposable
    Representation of an Android Layer that would be dropped over the top of the Video View pane.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description

      Construct a Video View Layer with a provided identifier and the view to be drawn over the top of the video being played.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VideoViewLayer

        public VideoViewLayer​(java.lang.String id,
                      android.view.View v,
                      android.widget.RelativeLayout.LayoutParams rlp)
        Create a video view layer as a set .
        Parameters:
        id - the unique identifier that describes the layer.
        v - the view that is to be displayed
        rlp - the layout parameters associated with the view.

      • VideoViewLayer

        public VideoViewLayer​(java.lang.String id,
                      android.view.View v,
                      android.widget.RelativeLayout.LayoutParams rlp,
                      boolean alwaysOn)
        Construct a Video View Layer with a provided identifier and the view to be drawn over the top of the video being played.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the video view
        v - the view
        rlp - the layout parameters for the view
        alwaysOn - if the view needs to be explicitly defined in the layers intent string array extra (false) or if it is always going to be shown (true).

      • VideoViewLayer

        public VideoViewLayer​(java.lang.String id,
                      android.view.View v,
                      android.widget.RelativeLayout.LayoutParams rlp,
                      boolean alwaysOn,
                      boolean enableStockMetadata)
        Construct a Video View Layer with a provided identifier and the view to be drawn over the top of the video being played.
        Parameters:
        id - the id of the video view
        v - the view
        rlp - the layout parameters for the view
        alwaysOn - if the view needs to be explicitly defined in the layers intent string array extra (false) or if it is always going to be shown (true).
        enableStockMetadata - if set to false, the stock metadata display for the frame center will not be rendered. It is up to this video view layer to render all desired metadata.

    • Method Detail

      • enableStructuredDecoding

        public final void enableStructuredDecoding()
        Enables more advanced structure decoding required by specifications such as VMTI. When a video is started, this is off by default.

      • start

        public void start​(ConnectionEntry connectionEntry,
                  boolean hasMetadata)
        Called when video processing has started.
        Parameters:
        connectionEntry - the connection entry representing the video

      • stop

        public void stop​(ConnectionEntry connectionEntry)
        Called when video processing has stopped.
        Parameters:
        connectionEntry - the connection entry representing the video

      • error

        public void error​(ConnectionEntry connectionEntry)
        Called when video processing was unable to start due to an error.
        Parameters:
        connectionEntry - the connection entry representing the video

      • snapshot

        public void snapshot​(ConnectionEntry connectionEntry,
                     java.io.File file)
        Called when a snapshot is taken.
        Parameters:
        connectionEntry - the connection entry representing the video

      • close

        public final void close()
        Call to close the drop down that is currently open. This can be used by implementations to close a drop down that is playing the video.

      • dispose

        public void dispose()
        Dispose the components that are set via the initialize
        Specified by:
        dispose in interface Disposable

      • setPan

        public void setPan​(int x,
                   int y)
        Called when the video is panned by the user.
        Parameters:
        x - the new center point x value
        y - the new center point y value

      • setScale

        public void setScale​(double scale)
        Called when the video is scaled by the user
        Parameters:
        scale - the new scale value

      • setViewMatrix

        public void setViewMatrix​(android.graphics.Matrix matrix)
        Called when the video is panned or scaled by the user
        Parameters:
        matrix - Matrix used to transform a view so it matches the video Note: Any overlay view MUST match the size of the entire video surface. Drawing code should treat the video as if it's stretched to cover the entire surface, since this matrix includes aspect ratio scaling and centering.

      • videoSizeChanged

        public void videoSizeChanged​(int w,
                             int h)
        Called when the video size has changed
        Parameters:
        w - New video width
        h - New video height

      • metadataChanged

        public void metadataChanged​(com.partech.pgscmedia.frameaccess.KLVData rawData,
                            java.util.Map<com.partech.pgscmedia.frameaccess.DecodedMetadataItem.MetadataItemIDs,​com.partech.pgscmedia.frameaccess.DecodedMetadataItem> items)
        The metadata change listener. This supplies both decoded and raw data
        Parameters:
        rawData - The raw metadata wrapped in a KLVData object.
        items - the decoded values as ids and items.

      • isAlwaysOn

        public boolean isAlwaysOn()
        Return true if the layer is always on . In the case that the layer is not always on, it will need to be explicity requested in order to be shown. See the intent used to launch the video with the extra intent.getStringArrayExtra("layers");
        Returns:
        true if the layer is always on or false if the layer needs to be explitly mentioned in the layers string array.

      • getEntry

        public ConnectionEntry getEntry()
        Get a copy of the connection entry
        Returns:
        the copy of the connection entry currently being used.

      • onLongPress

        public void onLongPress​(android.view.MotionEvent e)

      • requestBitmapFrame

        public void requestBitmapFrame​(BitmapFrameRequestCallback callback)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Requests the next available frame from the video consumer. Invoke only on the main UI thread.
        Parameters:
        callback - callback to be invoked when the request completes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if invoked when the layer is not initialized
